title: Professional and efficient
body: I visit rarely but when I do itâ€™s easy to access the surgery on the phone or on line. Recently has a telephone consultation which went well.  Just had flu vaccine which was carried out safely and quickly.

title: Flu clinic
body: The clinic was well organised I felt very safe .Staff helpful and guided us during the new way of delivering clinics safely

title: Excellent response
body: Having had problems with highBP and the need to call 111the day before, felt unwell the following day and contacted the surgery. Prompt call back from duty doctor and appointment given with instructions to present ASAP at surgery. Very quickly dealt with, with kindness and little fuss. Thank you.

title: Flu jabs
body: Arrived car park for the vaccination at 1100 and gone by 1110. Very efficient and well organised service by happy and cheerful staff as usual. Thank you for the care you have shown throughout these most difficult times to me and my wife, so all take care.

title: Friendly staff
body: Every member of staff I encountered were both friendly and helpful. Very refreshing and nice to see in such trying times. Thank you Radiology, porter and security staff

title: Excellent practice
body: Extremely well organised flu vaccination clinic, especially in light of the difficult circumstances faced during COVID pandemic.

title: My Son - Early intervention in Psychosis Team
body: My son attempted to take his life in Reading last year whilst studying at the town's University. Berkshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust urgently referred him to a team called Early Intervention in Psychosis based at Prospect Park Hospital, Honey End, Reading, RG30 4EJ. The staff member (my son's care coordinator) was exceptional during these difficult times, his voice was extremely soothing and very  informative all throughout. This staff member tried his best to make my son comfortable , never isolated and he did this whilst he was at his vulnerable living in university halls all alone over the summer vacation period. While I was 80 miles away, he managed to calm my worries down via the phone and review meetings to make the entire situation a better experience. I will never forget how his approachable professionalism adapted me to believe my son was in trustworthy hands and able to receive the care he needed. Any questions I needed answers to, he had the answer.. Any concerns, he always had the right things to say. I cannot thank him enough for his support throughout one of the hardest situations of my life. Now my son is back at home with the whole family, thanks to the support of this staff member, he sorted a hassle free transfer to a university closer by and further support from a Early Intervention in Psychosis team situated at our local general hospital.

title: Prescription not at chemist when told to pick up
body: On two occasions in the last three weeks after consultation with a nurse my wife was prescribed medication and was told to collect the next day. On the first occasion it was a medication needed urgently and in the end at 5 pm I went to the surgery and said I would not leave until I got the prescription. Finally at 5.30 I was handed the prescription. On Thursday the 1st Oct my wife had a telephone consultation with the same nurse. She was told she needed to double her dose so a prescription would be at her chemist the next day. On the Friday I contacted the chemist not there. Rang the practice and was told that both the nurse and the doctor who would sign the prescription were not in till Monday. I was told nothing could be done. I asked to speak to the manager once again and was told she was in a meeting till 5.30 when I said that's funny that was the same excuse last time this happened. Oh no sorry she's not in but it takes 48 to 72 hours to get a prescription.  So my wife couldn't increase the dose as requested and by Monday will have run out of medication she needs. It's a good job it's not life threatening.

title: Great practice
body: Have several health issues so frequently need to speak to the reception.  I have always found them to be very helpful and, if necessary, arrange for a doctor to call me which they invariably do.  The doctor listens to my problem and makes a referral to a consultant or NHS service as needed.  If I require a repeat prescription I can do this using the practice web site.  I have only praise for this practice.

title: Lack of sympathy and understanding at managementâ€¦
body: Although the care assistants and nurses here are excellent I had an overall very bad experience in my treatment with a general unsympathetic approach from management and some GP's which delayed treatment and was very stressful. I found one GP helpful and was able to get a referral to a specialist unit where my condition was then successfully treated. I have since left the practice.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: coinzw53
title: They do a wonderful job
body:
I give birth to my daughter at Craigavon hospital in mid-September, over 6 weeks early. The team in CAH midwives and doctors were amazing and I am very thankful my daughter was looked after there before being transferred to Daisy Hill SCBU where she still is.  
The team at Daisy Hill consultants, midwives, and now SCBU have been amazing. I had all my antenatal appointments there and several admissions with high blood pressure. They do a wonderful job and during these difficult times with no visitors they were on hand to reassure and guide me on my first pregnancy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice but struggling to access online
body: patient-services.co.uk was supposed to go offline 17/08/20 to 24/08/20. Online access was supposed to change to systmonline.tpp-uk.com. Had no access for six weeks ???

author: Lip
title: Reassured by kind endoscopy staff
body:
I had to attend for a sigmoidoscopy test having previously had a couple of these at other places.  
I would like to thank the doctors, nurses and all the staff involved for putting me at ease. They were all kind caring and attentive. Talking me through the procedure with their softly spoken words of reassurance.

author: Rogerf
title: Professional from reception to discharge
body:
I went to the Musgrove Park Hospital this week for a colonoscopy. The whole thing from reception to discharge went very professionally, it was extremely well done.  
I was seen on time, and the person on reception was first class. There was very little wait, and the nurses who saw me in before and after the actual procedure did their job very professionally.  
They asked me if I minded if a junior doctor under training actually performed the procedure, I said of course and he did very well. The consultant who was supervising him did an excellent job of guiding him.  
The whole thing went about as well as I could hope, and I was pleased with the results of the test, too!

author: redge35
title: A lovely time
body: Really good lovely time with her support worker

author: lioneg75
title: It was really helpful
body:
My husband and I are heroin addicts for 25 yrs. She mentioned that she missed phone calls from STARS, but while she was engaging with STARS it was really helpful.  
She intends to re-engage

author: Nicgm86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: High Intensity Service User Matron
body: Max came to visit my friend, as she has been in and out of hospital several times due to mental health, asthma and other related health conditions. Max was open, honest and we had a really good conversation, it didn't feel like she was being assessed. He has really helped her think differently about her health and gave me some really good strategies to support my friend to self manage better - he's been one of the best professionals she's has seen in recent months.

author: travellercz54
title: They are always there for me
body:
When I first got to Redwood 2 I felt alone and unsupported for the first 2 months. Eventually I got a 1:1 with Nurse Sue and she helped me to be able to ask my consultant what I need (mood stabiliser).  
Also Nurse Morrigan was really supportive and helped me through some trauma stuff. She has helped me write two letters which have been really useful. Sue and Morrigan are always there for me and understand me. I am very grateful.  
I have come a long way since I came to Redwood 2 from self harming severely, regularly, to being 3 weeks + self harm free. I couldn't have done it without Morrigan's support. I am so glad the staff took the glass and razor blades from me because now I am almost 2 months cut-free.

title: Very efficient
body: Went for a flu jab on Sat 3/10/2020. They could not have been more efficient. In and out in 5 minutes. Excellent.

title: Flu Jab
body: The vaccination arrangements at Uplands  School were very efficient and well organised. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Well-organised flu jab clinic
body:
I received a text message asking if I would attend for a flu jab. I emailed the practice saying that I would and promptly received an appointment for a few days later. 
On the day it couldn't have been better. It was well organised and I was in and out in a few minutes. Organisation was excellent and at the limited interactions with staff (to check-in and to received the jab) they were helpful and pleasant.
Good all round.

author: Nds
title: NHS Mishandling of my health
body:
I have been unwell for 6 months and have 2 children and a husband who are watching me deteriorate in front of their eyes . I have had to fight for the NHS to investigate as i was constantly being dismissed . Upon doing a few test and not getting to the bottom of what is wrong I have now being left being unwell with my Gp saying if i have worsening of symptoms go to a and e , a and e saying as my illness is not acute i need to go to GP . I have been in hospital as an inpatient several times , at the GP , phoning calls to GP and attending a and e to be dismissed each and every time . I have told them since I received the few investigations into my case in June 2020 that my symptoms have changed / worsened and I am still being dismissed .To the point where one of the medical team I saw has wrote on my medical notes that the NHS have to provide no further investigation into my case and have made sure to have my Gp put on my medical notes that only reassurance has to be offered to me . I have complained to the health board , my local MSP and GP to no avail , to what I can only imagine is due to what it wrote on my medical notes (which I had requested a copy from my GP , so I can see what has been wrote) .I believe a member of staff wrote lies on my record and I am being discriminated against due to my medical notes , which a lot of claims made about me are untrue .  
I am appalled by the treatment of the NHS and I will be taking this further . My children are worried sick for my life and ask multiple times per day if I am going to die . This is heart breaking and unacceptable. How can a person who has been unwell for 6 months and lost over 3 stone in weight with many symptoms and the fact that I canâ€™t eat foods and are trying to keep myself alive on a few meal replacement drinks per day be left in this way ? I have on many occasions asked for a feeding tube to help with nutrition which has been declined as well . It was said that due to the fact that this may cause lazy swallowing and no quality of life for me . What quality of life have I got now ? I am completely bed bound and are extremely unwell with no energy and not able to eat and only able to take minimal fluids per day , which makes me experience extreme stomach pains and sickness.  
My symptoms have progressed to the following Difficulty swallowing liquids and foods, I have lost 47 pounds in weight, indigestion, regurgitation, nausea, clicking throat, tongue constantly coated white and is worse when consuming foods/liquids, blood pressure has been lowering, stomach pains, constipation, bloating, feeling full very easy, fatigue, sore throat which is sorer in the morning, leg weakness and leg jerks.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Excellent Experience
body: I attended on Saturday for a flu vaccination. It was a very smooth and easy appointment. Very efficient and quick and staff were friendly and professional. Couldnâ€™t praise them enough. Excellent surgery, wouldnâ€™t consider going anywhere else. Thank you.

title: Rude, incompetent and unprofessional staff
body: rude unprofessional staff who hang up the phone and interrupt when trying to speak to them. They need customer service training and some kind of people skills course. Terrible service considering the state of the country. Absolutely atrocious!!!!!!

title: Great practice
body:
A well organised surgery, especially as regards the recent flu vaccinations which were carried out smoothly, efficiently and safely.
Staff always friendly and helpful.

title: Friendly efficient practice
body: To have my flu vaccination everything was very efficient and well timed, I didnâ€™t have to queue or come into contact with other patients which I was very pleased about.

title: Crisis team useless in a crisis
body: 111 referred partner to crisis team after three days of extreme anxiety and panic attacks. Waited five hours for a call back...in itself not really helpful for someone in crisis. Phone call only achieved one thing...made him worse. He told the nurse he needed help desperately and was told they are only a helpline!!! I thought crisis resolution and home treatment meant something more than a helpline. When he told her it was so bad he wanted to hurt himself she said it was good that he hadn't! How is anyone supposed to engage with these people??? It's a joke!

readBy.name: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust

author: Nicgm86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Pulmonary Rehab - Rushcliffe
body: I Was referred to the Pulmonary rehab team as my COPD and condition was caused from a cancer I had many years ago, and the GP was unsure if rehab was the best place for me to attend. I liaised with Claire the Physiotherapists, following conversations we had planned that the rehab 6 week programme wasn't the  most suitable  type of intervention, but offered me a one to one breathing technique session, unfortunately  this  could not go ahead due to the Coronavirus. Claire contacted me to offer virtual follow up which I accepted, Claire gave me the time, patience and information that was needed to set myself up for this new virtual conversation, which I found very helpful. I undertook some practice runs and then spoke to Claire. I would of preferred face to face but I know this currently is not possible. the virtual discussions enabled good exploration, assessment and information, I was given advise to help and overall I have been very happy with the service given

title: Access Team
body: The access team are marvellous so caring and helpful 5* they been have to see me many times at home and everyone is extremely professional treat me as a person not a number .If anyone is struggling contact them they are brilliant

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Marvellous service
body: Had flu jabs today - magnificent service . Efficient, compassionate, professional â€“ several gold stars from  our perspective

title: Avoid
body: I have been attending this practice for years and it has gone downhill in the past 3-4 years. Since they abolished the assigned GP to catchment area system, they have introduced this 'lottery style' appointment system whereby you must call at 8 am to get a call from a doctor (can no longer book in advance) and by 8:04 all appointments are taken. This system requires an immediate review as there have been cases with both myself, my family and neighbours were unable to get an appointment for very serious issues which could only be escalated by a GP. Additionally, the receptions are rude and lie about appointment availablity. After finally getting through, (I was put on hold for 10 mins and after picking up the receptionist forgot to mute herself and I overheard rude comments) the receptionist told me there were no appointments with the doctor I requested and when I told her that I do not feel comfortable talking to any other doctor (as I have been talking to my requested doctors for many years now) she then immediately told me she had an appointment out of thin air! Straight after telling me the doctor was fully booked....these 2 factors make the surgery seem highly unprofessional and off-putting to approach. I hope that there are some changes in the near future as I am not the only one who has encountered this.

author: RlEL
title: Outstanding care
body: I have taken my 3 yr old daughter to A& E recently at MPH a number of times due to her having asthma and struggling to breath. Just want to say how amazing the staff were. One of the Night HCAâ€™s Leah went out of her way to come and see my daughter after remembering her from a previous visit. The care she delivered to my daughter on both occasions was outstanding by trying to make my daughter feel at ease by talking to her and bringing her toys to play with, she was very friendly and approachable so just want to say a massive thank you!

title: Flu jab - As always an extremely good surgery.
body:
Visiting the surgery to have my flu jab - I felt extremely safe with the screening, dealt with professional, & friendly staff.  Could not be more efficient.
I didnâ€™t expect anything else from this surgery as they are always the above.  
Doctors who listen & explain - making you feel at ease & polite staff.  
Thank you to you all.

author: Claire78
title: My son having suspected cellulitis
body: Had to take my 5 year old son down to childrenâ€™s a& e as his hands and some of his arms were turning red and very hot and he was complaining of hurting him when I got there the last on reception was really good and helpful and we didnâ€™t sit for more than 10 minutes before we got seen. A Nurse called Angela took us through to a room and with a student nurse called Taylor took all the obs that they needed and made him feel happy and relax they checked him over before going to another room where a doctor called Otto came in and sat and explained that my son had suspected cellulitis due to either a fall at school he had the previous day or a wee scratch he had on side of hand then nurse Angela came back to give him his medication that he needed and explained what needed to be done she was so attentive with him and cannot thank her and the others nurse and doctor that night for what they did for my son and advise me to keep an eye on him and heâ€™s so much better now thank you again

title: Saturday flu clinic
body: I was very impressed with the organisation,speed and professional manner that the flu jab was carried out.I was in and out of the building in less than two minutes.

author: Cbthelpedthankyou
title: CBT helped me so much
body: Jason helped me so much and although still a long way to go empowered me with a kind ear and useful techniques. Would highly recommend thanks Jason

title: Excellent care and efficiency
body: Excellent care from Walk-in clinic and Eye Casualty on consecutive days (staff including greeters, receptionists, triage nurses, doctors, pharmacy). Efficient but courteous and seemingly-unrushed attention, thus reassuring. Entertained by cleaners in waiting-rooms who sweep in to clean seats the instant they are vacated: like watching hawks swoop on prey (their prey being any covid virus). Thanks and well-done to all, both patient-facing and behind the scenes, because good thought has gone into the system that enables the services in A&E and Outpatients.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Flu Jab Session
body: The flu jab session on 3 October 2020 was extremely well organised and, as usual, the staff were very welcoming and efficient.

title: Good experience
body: I attended the Parsonage surgery for flu vaccination appointment. It was well organised and quick. Thanks

title: Brilliant service
body: In March 2020, thinking I had the flu, I phoned my GP coughing and spluttering - she summoned an ambulance for me and I was in hospital within the hour. This was a life saving decision as it turned out I had COVID and I was sedated and on a ventilator for a whole month, during which time according to the ITU staff I nearly died. Since being discharged i have daily dressing changes at the surgery - I always manage to get an appointment at a convenient time and am seen promptly. The nurses and reception staff are kind, patient and welcoming. We are so lucky to have this surgery - a real credit to the NHS !!

title: Excellent Organisation
body: Visited the surgery for our Flu Vaccination. Great system, fantastic nurse, In and out signs were spot on. Brilliant ðŸ‘‹

title: Rude receptionist who has zero care
body: After being involved in a RTA I was told by paramedics to contact my surgery ASAP. On doing so (after at least 10 unanswered calls) I was told Very abruptly to call 111. After calling 111 (who told me to contact the surgery) I went to the surgery, the receptionist told me to go away and call 111 and do an online consult, the online consult told me to call 111, 111 told me to contact the surgery. Do you see any problem here?????

title: Fantastic
body: Flu jab appointment was for 12.12. I arrived 12.11 and left the premises a few minutes later having had the jab. How good is that! This practice is excellent.

title: Flu jab clinic
body: I just wanted to say thank you very much for your fantastic organisation with the flu jab clinic on Saturday morning. I came with my 11yr old son in the pouring rain (we were both having the vaccination) but we were both in and out super quickly. Well done everyone! A great job especially in the current COVID situation!

title: Great practice rude reception team
body: I love the GPs at Elborough Street Surgery but on several occasions now I have had calls and interactions with the most rude reception team members. Dismissive and inconsiderate, clearly donâ€™t want to be working, and see patients as a nuisance. Not happy to help. Iâ€™ve had kinder service from waiters in a restaurant. Most recently I sobbed on the phone because a lady was so rude and kept dismissing me to use the app despite having an emergency letter from the hospital and being in pain. She wouldnâ€™t even hear me out. Iâ€™m considering leaving the practice because of my mistreatment, which is a shame because the Doctors and Nurses are amazing.

title: Influenza Vaccination
body: Attended 3rd October (a Saturday). Extremely cheerful and professional staff guided me through an extremely safe and well thought out process for the flu jab.

author: AnonFirstTimeMum
title: Lack of support
body:
My hope is that by sharing my experience that others wonâ€™t feel the same as I did.  
I gave birth to a baby girl in August, this following being induced. The experience of being induced was fine, the staff on that ward could not have been more supportive. After a couple of days I was ready to be moved to labour ward to start the process I was offered the opportunity to go for a bath and have lunch and move to the ward at 12pm that day. I waited until around 3pm, I had not yet been moved yet no one came to inform me of any delays. I had to actively seek this out by pressing the buzzer. My partner was allowed to stay from 9am-9pm during this process. At no point was my partner asked to wear a mask as we were in our own room.  
I was moved at 6pm, almost six hours, this was on the Wednesday after having started the induction process on Tuesday afternoon. Again when on the labour suite the midwife and student midwife were amazing. However one staff member was particularly rude to my partner due to not wearing a mask, they were however at the other side of a very large private room. I was in labour from 6pm that evening until the early hours of the morning however no concerns were flagged due to the lack of progress and the fact that the baby was back to back and very far up the birth canal. This was not flagged until a change of shift and a new midwife. Despite consideration being given to an emergency c-section at 4am due to lack of progress. I was left until 8am until decisions were made, this resulted in a very rushed and dramatic trip to theatre. Luckily my baby was born safe and sound, however this could have been a different situation given the decelerations that were noted during monitoring.  
Within the theatre, the team were amazing however I was slightly annoyed that I and my partner was asked to wear a mask, I protested and given I was throwing up the mask was reluctantly removed. My partner did however have to meet her daughter for the first time with a mask on which I feel is completely unacceptable.  
I was then moved to the post natal ward, I had my own very large room and my partner was only allowed to stay six hours post-birth. As you can imagine I was extremely sore and had not even had the Catheter removed when they asked her to leave. She left and we were then informed that she would only be permitted to visit for two hours the following day, this despite me having a newborn and recovering from surgery. I could barely get on and off the bed or attend to any of my own personal care let alone look after a baby with little support. We were also surprised given she was permitted to stay from 9-9 during induction yet limited after her daughter had been born.  
I was also provided with paracetamol and ibuprofen as my pain relief, only when being discharged was I provided with a prescription of Dihydrocodine and advised I should have been having these throughout. During the overnight stay I missed a dose of painkillers, this resulted in waking in extreme pain, it was only after I asked for them three times that I was provided with pain relief.  
The support within the postnatal ward was extremely lacking given partners were not permitted. I waited three hours on the feeding team supporting me which resulted in an upset mum and baby. This for me damaged my preference of breastfeeding and as a result I opted to give her a bottle. I was not offered a demonstration bath for the baby nor did anyone even check I had the appropriate supplies at home.  
I feel the general care and wellbeing aspect within Wishaw General, more so within the postnatal ward was completely lacking. The food was awful, barely any fruit or veg to be seen. The room was disgusting, there were smear marks up the wall in the shower, which I cleaned myself with antibacterial wipes.  
Given the overall care I received within the postnatal ward I decided to leave at 4pm the following day after having an emergency section. I was in no way physically or emotionally ready to leave the hospital however I felt I had no choice due to the restrictions, poor conditions and lack of support.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: They never answer their phones
body: Iâ€™ve been in there for appoints and seen reception staff staring at a screen and letting the phone ring out. Itâ€™s so hurtful to watch. The lack of respect for people clearly sick trying to speak to someone is awful. Iâ€™m pregnant and have been trying to speak to them for 2 days now! No one answers. This morning itâ€™s had a busy tone since 8am. Looks like once again Iâ€™ll have to contact 111 as my GP wonâ€™t help me. Such a shame as the doctors are lovely; but unless they sort reception out I can see many more complaints arising....

title: Very professional
body: I arrived early for my flu jab but was seen straight away. Very good and safe- in one door and out another. All done within 5 mins.

title: Flue Jab
body: Clear instructions when arriving, careful thought put into organisation and overall the experience was very positive.

title: Flue Jab
body: Kind and efficient welcome. Clear instructions given of where to wait and the floor was marked out to help too.  Waited no time at all and the nurse giving the injection was quick, kind and gave clear advice.

title: Great Idea !
body: Given the practice is generally closed people are asked to go into a corridor where there is no ventilation and ring a bell so that the staff at reception can bring prescriptions etc. In the middle of a pandemic i think it's a really great idea... let's get Corona done... There is a sign saying 'no more than 2 people inside at the same time' but obviously it's being ignored/unoticed as lost in the middle of numerous other posters. When i went there last week there was 3 of us in there and one with a mask on her chin of course, she had been running as she was late so was breathing out heavily and coughing (i'm not exagerating). Does not take a genius to work out that this kind of situation would arise so I don't know why they did not think of another way to organise this...

title: 'Flu clinic
body: Very impressed with the organization and execution of the "drive through" 'flu clinic. Very smooth  and efficient operation by friendly and well organised team. Fantastic effort. Thanks to all involved and roll on next year. Stay safe.

author: corvuscc79
title: Really good experience
body:
Deborah found her experience very consistent given the current lockdown.  
All in all really good experience.

author: volansbz93
title: Felt comfortable, at ease and safe
body:
The staff at South Tyrone Hospital are fantastic. Made me feel comfortable, at ease + safe. Patients are being cared for whilst adhering to social distancing. The place is very clean, airy and spacious.  
I'd prefer coming to STH for my treatments as opposed to CAH, as it's much closer to home.  
Well done staff!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: GaD3791
title: I was treated as an individual
body:
I was apprehensive, as I'm sure most people are, when I had to attend the department for a colonoscopy procedure. The staff were brilliant though, really put me at ease, explained everything, and made me feel as comfortable throughout the experience as is possible.  
From making the appointment to leaving Recovery, I felt like I was treated as an individual rather than yet another patient passing through a busy department.

author: Shut out
title: appointment
body: Spent a week in Basildon Hospital recently, superb care, brilliant nursing.Now trying to contact the Rheumatology clinic with a simple question about my wife's medication and it's a totally different experience. Is there nobody in their admin office able to pick up a phone, I've been trying for hours.

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Satisfied 72
title: accessing help at GP
body: My son was struggling and I felt he needed support. Dr Morton was very supportive and helpful. I was very impressed at her level of concern and attention throughout the whole experience.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Damion
title: Cancellation of venesection clinic
body:
As I have high levels of ferritin in blood I have been receiving venesections over the past couple of years on 2 weekly bases, since lock-down our clinics have closed, I have been to my GP and she has referred me back to my consultant in the hospital about 2 months ago - never had a reply.  
I have recently visited the clinic to ask when it would be open no reply and know due to my levels going high again I am feeling extremely exhausted, bruising is really bad and cuts, etc not healing, levels were high and had them down significantly, but after months of not receiving this service, I am worried that this is going to affect my time at work. So it would be very interesting if someone knows of where I can go to receive treatment that would be great.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Satisfied 72
title: Unwell child during pandemic
body:
After contacting GP practice about concerns regarding my 9 year old I was given an appointment to see Dr McCollum. She was lovely and reassuring towards my son. A very positive experience in these unprecedented times.  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: DisgustedbyLincolnHosp
title: Not being listened to
body: I damaged my knee playing rugby and so went along to the hospital and discharged with a hemotherosis... the pain didnâ€™t get any better and even a brush from my dressing gown hurt it so I knew it wasnâ€™t right. After months and a number of visits to the hospital each time being told there was nothing wrong with me... One doctor actually walked out of the room whilst my wife and I try to tell him the symptoms they finally did an arthroscopy. A bucket handle tear was found but the pain didnâ€™t stop, at this point I was told I just had a low pain threshold. I did pretty well boxing and playing rugby for over 20 years being soft! Itâ€™s 2 years on and all though Iâ€™ve now been diagnosed with CRPS I still seem to be ignored, the latest person I saw on entering the room asking is it both knees, which one is it? Surely they read the notes... apparently not, failing that the mottled waxy appearance, swelling and loss of hair on the affected knee should have given it away. Absolutely disgusted with the treatment Iâ€™ve received & is completely unfair on my wife and baby girl who are also suffering through my inability to play or give a respite to, as the pain can be so horrific in the afternoon all I want to do is go to bed and literally not move. I feel so low, even to the point where I genuinely think Iâ€™m on the cusp of a mental breakdown.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: sierrafk46
title: The staff are respectful
body:
I have been here for nearly 6 years.  
I find the staff to be approachable and diligent when performing tasks. This sort of approach has made me settle quickly and in a good frame of mind.  
Rampton has got an excellent healthcare centre which caters for all of our needs, dentist, doctors, podiatrist, physiotherapist.  
Improving the service for deaf patients would be to utilise the video conferencing proposal. The staff are respectful and understand that our language is different to theirs and they are receiving the training necessary to bridge that gap.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: frostpq69
title: Support for patient and carer
body:
Although I could see that my husband was losing mental capacity - it took a long time to convince our GP, but eventually we were referred to the mental health dept at Lings Bar Hospital. The staff were quick to realise that my husband's memory was much worse than stated by the GP.  
We had regular appointments for assessment. These were conducted sympathetically with quick follow-up feedback in written form. Eventually my husband was given a diagnosis of mixed dementia which was explained clearly to us and the correct medication prescribed. I was informed of the many sources of help for patient and carer.  
We cannot fault the service we received from this department which made us feel valued as both patient and carer.

author: aquariusky58
title: Support worker was really good
body: Found it ok, the lady he was with as a supporter work was really good.

author: humanitiesqx37
title: It was a little difficult
body: Found the group session didn't help. Opening up in front of people was a little difficult. The one to one really good and helpful

author: charlieqz66
title: Perfect care
body:
My care was perfect  
Staff was very pleasant and caring  
the ward is bright and spotless  
could not have asked for better care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: NoSmoking
title: Smoking at hospital entrance
body:
Every visit we are faced with walking through smokers at the entrance of hospitals. This is not healthy, pleasant or fair. We have a child who has asthma attacks when exposed to such pollutants and itâ€™s disgusting to have to push a child through a cloud of smoke just to get to an appointment for their health. The staff and patients health is important.  
I raised my complaint with the hospital who shared my frustration on the matter, but as it is not law, they have limited power to stop smokers smoking at the entrances of hospitals and when staff do ask people to move on, they are faced with abuse.  
This is unacceptable. I feel this needs to be written into law somehow, hospitals are places for health to improve not worsen. Itâ€™s supposed to be a safe place for patients and children, it should not be a place to be exposed to second hand smoke.

author: Karn Mac
title: Totally at ease
body: I can't rate the staff on ward 18 highly enough extremely efficient and caring. Dr Addison is an amazing surgeon who also makes you feel totally at ease

author: The 2nd daughter
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: My dad
body:
My dad was admitted via ED at Monklands at the end of Sept. He was met by a very caring and professional set of nurses. Michelle you put dad and me at ease and explained everything you did, you are a very professional and caring nurse.  
Sorry I can't remember the other nurses names, but you were all amazing,. Lisa the advanced practitioner examined dad and explained everything to us both, you are so kind and incredibly knowledgeable.  
To the nurses on ward 19 you kept my wee dad going, when we could not come and visit. Linda and Anne please give my families thanks to all the nurses and care assistants who treated my dad with dignity and respect. Currently my dad is in ward 20. To say his wife and 6 kids miss him so much is an understatement. But in true Lanarkshire nursing style, were you go above and beyond, for your patients.  
The young technical nurses on ward 20 nightshift, managed to hook my dad, who can't even work the TV remote! up by zoom call to us. I can't tell you what that meant to mum and the family just to have that time with dad. You make me so proud to be a Lanarkshire nurse! We do an amazing job for our patients and I feel so grateful, to know my dad is getting the best care possible.  
Please also pass my family's gratitude to all the doctors especially Ryan on ward 19, who took the time to update me on the phone on dads progress. And the physio who called mum today, she really appreciated all the help and advice you gave.  
Yours sincerely

author: concernedcitizen
title: Smokers outside hospitals main entrances
body:
I am becoming increasingly fed up with the smokers loitering outside the QEUH main entrance.  
Firstly, the passive smoking has a detrimental effect on the overall health of patients, carers and staff entering and leaving the building, most of whom choose not to smoke.  
Secondly, an abandoned cigarette outside the main door caused a fire evacuation for multiple clinical areas for almost two hours, two weeks ago. This disrupted a number of outpatient services, meaning clinics were running late or appointments were cancelled. This affects patient care and service efficiency. Further, the story was also picked up by several media outlets, affecting the reputation of the hospital.  
Thirdly, the increased footfall of smokers moving in and out the hospital is an infection control issue, particularly as the smokers are typically wearing masks around their necks and actively blowing/ exhaling their breath to the surrounding areas. This is not preventing the spread of COVID-19.  
This issue needs to be appropriately dealt with. The current 'no smoking signs' do not work. Furthermore, when staff have approached those smoking on hospital grounds they are more often than not met with verbal aggression.  
My suggestion is that either the Scottish Government bring in a law to make smoking / vaping illegal on hospital grounds or that designated smoking areas are built away from the front door.  
I should also note this does not only happen outside QEUH. It happens at other hospital sites.

author: Emmrd63
title: Community Advocacy Service
body:
I referred myself to Advocacy Support Cymru for an advocate to help me re access the CMHT service after I recently requested a re assessment myself but the CMHT would not take me back on.  
I was hopeful when ASC called me back but as I'm not under a CMHT, I was told they cant do anything other than sign post. They are just another service unable to help.

author: bexxmcl
title: Homebirth with the Ayrshire & Arran homebirth team
body:
Being pregnant during the pandemic became a really anxious time for me with the (understandable) changes to how care was being given. I was really keen to get to know my midwife & build a relationship but sadly this couldn't happen & I started to consider if a homebirth would be the right decision for me & my baby.  
I emailed the team back in May & the even the email I got in return was compassionate & caring. I then (safely) met Mags when she came to my home to give me all/any information I needed & by the time she left I had signed myself into the care of the homebirth team. The support from Mags/the team began instantly & I began to relax about birthing during a pandemic. Mags treated me on a personal level & we built a relationship which was so important to me. I felt like I could reach out whenever I needed to & if Mags wasn't available another team member would step in & again I always felt I was speaking to a friend.  
The journey I have been on during Mags' care healed my previous birth trauma & I will always be incredibly thankful to her! I was then referred to a 4 week zoom class for Hypnobirthing with Diane & this proved to be invaluable! Diane really opened my eyes to how powerful hypnobirthing is & always took the time to answer any questions any of us had fully, nothing was out of bounds. Again, even over a zoom call Diane made me feel comfortable & supported.  
I really believe this type of birth education is vital. I lucked out on the night my son decided he was ready to enter the world as Diane was on call for me & she took the time to call me to say she was on her way. I was excited to have a midwife who had taken the hypnobirthing classes & who I was familiar with!  
Gill was my second midwife on call & again when she arrived I felt instantly comfortable & familiar towards her. Diane & Gill were AMAZING. They supported me through the magical & empowering birth I had dreamed of having in the comfort of my living room. I led the way & felt in control knowing I had a dream team with me. All my wishes were respected & both Diane & Gill guided me where they knew I needed it. My partner also felt comfortable & supported which helped him relax & be a greater aid to me.  
My son was born around midnight one day towards the end of Sept & both Diane & Gill checked in on us via text/call later in the day time which meant so much. My son then had most of his checks with Diane & having consistency was another extremely important factor for me. It was so nice to have her back & we chatted the whole time she visited. Gill also made sure she got to come to see us all for one check & again we chatted the whole time. I will FOREVER be grateful to these 3 women who have made a huge impact on my birth story which I treasure & I hope they get the recognition they truly deserve. The homebirth service needs to be shouted about from the NHS.  
My recovery has been a breeze, my son is a calm & happy baby which I believe is down to how I experienced birth & how he experienced entering the world. I cannot express my thanks enough!  
THANK YOU!

author: Nobby3
title: Day Surgery operation
body: The care and attention from start to finish was professional, caring and spot on.   All the staff were considerate in their dealing and explantations.   Felt very safe within a clinically clean environment.   Great facilities and always kept clean. Special mention to Lisa (Staff Nurse) who was on the duty of myself and others on arrival and throughout my care.

author: Titwf75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Online Mindfulness Course
body: I mostly enjoyed the guided visualisations and the mindful colouring. It seemed that the course was a bit top heavy on staff vs participants and that the staff did most of the talking. Participants should have a chance to say more.

author: Titwf75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Online Creating Mindfulness Course
body: Course was good. Conversations during breakout sessions were open & honest. I enjoyed the meditation practices during each sessions as it helped me to relax. Also liked the mindful colouring in 3rd session as although I'm not into colouring & can't even remember last time I did, found it rather relaxing & was pleased with the outcome albeit it was with highlighters. I wasn't a fan of some of the videos we watched as I couldn't make head or tail out of a couple of them. Overall, the course went well & I took a lot out of it. Thanks.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Mizunogroupie
title: Minor procedure
body:
Just in for minor procedure on scalp for skin cancer investigation.  
The nurses are brilliant, I didn't want to leave.  
My observation is, NO WALL HOOKS !  
We're asked to change into gowns by our bed but there isn't anywhere to hang up our clothes ?  
Nipped to the loo in dressing gown and hospital gown BUT nowhere to hang your dressing gown up ?  
It's strange, hospital so conscientious about hygiene and cleanliness yet we have to drop clothing onto the floor in the toilet.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: Bilateral TKR
title: Wonderful pre-op assessment
body:
I saw Jackie for my pre op assessment and she is wonderful. She explained everything clearly, she is very upbeat and friendly, just what I needed.  
Then I went to ward 10 for my RTKR 9 weeks ago and they were ALL equally as lovely as Jackie. I was throughly looked after and couldnâ€™t have asked for better.  
Today I went for another pre op assessment and Jackie was looking after me again and just as kind, considerate and calming as the first time. It has all been an amazing experience and I really want to thank you all.

author: Ms PM
title: Excellent professional and dignified care.
body: My father was treated under the Dermatology team at Stobhill ACH last week. The care he received was professional and expert. The team looking after him did so with utmost compassion and had his best interests at the forefront of the treatment. In particular, HCSW Ann and Dermatologist Colin were extremely professional and gained the approval of my dad in the way they approached him and understood him and he was very grateful for that.

author: VeryHappyMan
title: I've never had better treatment
body: Yesterday I attended the day surgery unit at Queen Margarets Hospital in Dunfermline. From the minute I arrived to the minute I was discharged I have never had better treatment in my life and I have had over 14 operations in many other hospitals.   The attention and care shown by all the ward staff was above and beyond.   This care continued with the theatre staff who were fantastic along with my surgeon.   Big thanks to mark the anaestatist and all his team in what was a difficult time.   The fact that I was able to have this operation on a day surgery basis was a great plus and to go home later that day.

title: Great service as always
body: I had to visit the minor injury unit with cellulitis in my leg I was seen fast and was in and out in under an hour with the appropriate medication. The nurses are always great and very caring

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu Jab
body: We were invited to attend the surgery for a flu Jab. The timings were organised alphabetically.  Upon arrival the staff processed us quickly with the usual checks on general health and Coronavirus symptoms. Social distance was maintained and hand sanitised were offered at each stage. Our jabs were administered by a GP and the whole thing was quick and efficient.

title: Friendly practice
body: Very efficiently run Flu injection clinic. I felt quite safe during these Corona virus pendemic times

title: Great Practice
body: The care my Downs Syndrome daughter received on Hunter Ward following an emergency admission was excellent. She was extremely poorly with peritonitis & I was allowed to stay with her for extra support which allowed her to cope with her 12 day stay & subsequent 4 day re admission stay. All members of the staff were incredibly supportive and considerate and we were very grateful for the high standard of care she received. Thank you all.

title: Excellent Service
body:
The vaccine program was well communicated.
Very well planned on the day. 
We have been with this surgery for almost 30 years. We have always received excellent service.

title: not answering phones
body: I understand due to covid that many GP practices are very busy with calls etc but this surgery never seems to answer the phone. You will be placed in a queue which then cuts off once you are closer to being number one in the queue. This has not happened on just one occasion. I have been phoning for a while now for a follow up appointment and this has happened on each occasion. Just very poor service. What are we supposed to do if we cant get through to our GP surgery?

author: aquilajd65
title: Staff are attentive and friendly
body: Regularly attend Queen Margaret Hospital, Clinical Intervention Unit, for venesections. Staff in this unit are very attentive and friendly.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Flu jab
body: My Wife and I were messaged about our flu jabs and invited to attend the surgery on Saturday morning. We received appointments almost immediately and the Service at the clinic was extremely efficient . The time slot system worked very well

title: Amazing practice
body: The reception staff are always polite and go out of their way to help you despite the fact it is a very busy surgery. My G.P has been amazing over the last new he has gone over and above to help me with various issues and I would of been lost without him.. not what the problem or how it takes me to explain in you never feel under pressure.. Thank - you every one at Newington Road Surgery Ramsgate Kent.

author: cubexp54
title: Heart attack
body: I felt utterly scared witless, however made so comfy and relaxed by everyone kept informed throughout and. All nurses and doc were amazing. Laura kept me informed on a daily and hourly basis cannot fault anyone or anything with anybody. Just superb unbelievable care. Dr Mohammed was so cool and reassuring spoke on an eye level when sitting down which ia comforting.

author: jupiterzt63
title: Amazing care at maternity triage
body:
10 days after having a c section, my wound was leaking. I had my baby at another hospital, but upon calling Northwick Park ( my local hosp) they were so helpful at putting my anxiety at ease. And invited me to Triage to be treated.  
Lesley (triage reception) even welcomed me at the door asking if I was the person who had called. I got seen so quickly and effectively (I had left my newborn at home so was keen not to hang around) the triage Midwife at the time Mercy was very reassuring and caring and it made the whole experience just seamless and stress-free.  
I would love for Leslie and Mercy to be recognised for their incredible service and compassion. They treated everyone through the door in the same way! Hidden Heroes !

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: alcoholfreeme
title: Alcohol Detox and Abstinence
body:
Over the years alcohol (particularly wine in the evening) became a daily part of my life and was seriously affecting my health, including the onset of type-2 diabetes.  
After trying to cut back or take days off from drinking wine I realised that it was no longer achievable through will power alone. In other words I needed help and support.  
Fortunately my GP also recognised this and pointed me towards a self referral to CGL (Change Grow Live).  
From the moment I contacted my local branch (Tameside) and arrived for my initial consultation I knew that I was in the right place. The greeting was warm, friendly and supportive.  
I suppose at first I felt like I was wasting their time and that mine was a minor issue compared to some of the people coming and going through the waiting area. However, the councillor I saw explained that everybody's journey with alcohol addiction was different but also very real, and help was available as long as I was prepared to be honest to myself and those supporting me.  
That short conversation convinced me that I could do this and regain control over my spiralling weight and declining health, so I made the commitment to myself there and then to take control.  
There are a number of options for managing alcohol dependence, and the team at Tameside are fully supportive in exploring the option that works best. There's no 'one cap fits all' approach. Each case is personal, and interestingly CGL is not anti-alcohol, but more about alcohol management and recognising that alcohol is a part of our social society.  
For me though - my choice after exploring all the options was to detox and take a break completely from drinking so that I could re-set my system and hopefully further down the line reintroduce drinking wine at a moderate and sensible level.  
A complete detox is a medically supervised arrangement where you are given medication over 3, 5 or 7 days to help with the effects and symptoms caused by withdrawing from alcohol. Ordinarily a support nurse would call each day to monitor your health. Unfortunately, when I did my detox it was at the height of the Covid lockdown so house calls were not permitted.  
However, the team at Tameside stepped up to the challenge with twice daily telephone contact including a support nurse, clinician and mental health councillor.  
I honestly couldn't have felt more supported.  
Even after the week long detox the support still continued throughout the abstinence period until I'd developed my own coping strategies, and even now (months into abstinence) the support is still there.  
I can't thank CGL enough, and particularly the team at Tameside for their advice, support and dedication, especially given the unprecedented times we are currently in and the restrictive working conditions.  
Many thanks.  
P. s. I mentioned at the start that my thoughts were to one day hopefully reintroduce alcohol at a sensible and moderate level. As time has gone on my thoughts are now that I don't need it in my life anymore, and therefore it's very unlikely alcohol will have any importance or hold any sway in my life ever again.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Kea
title: Admitted to hospital unexpectedly
body: I was referred to AAU after what I thought would be a routine GP appointment to discuss a recent recurring ailment. I was obviously scare to be in such a position but the team of Dr El-Taweel and Lynn were amazing and really put me at ease and no question was too much. I was admitted and the team on Ward 5 were fantastic and had such a laugh with the porters and nurses which gave light relief to a serious situation. My stay resulted in follow up appointments with DME/stoke pathway/neurology and each team were sympathetic, professional, empathetic and a true credit to NHS Borders.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Jojo56
title: understanding staff
body: I had day surgery with the gynecology department. They were all so understanding of my depression and anxiety. I had a panic attack when I came into the ward and they got me a chair. All the staff from the nurses to the doctor were very understanding and explained everything they needed to to do to me before they did it. They made something that was very hard for me a lot easier. I would like to thank all the staff for taking that little bit of extra time to talk to me.

title: Very poor patient care
body:
Text by surgery telling us to make appointments for blood pressure test and check ups. My wife and I are both OAPs and have medical conditions that are suppose to be monitored. Have spent literally hours on the phone trying to get through - line always busy. Any good reviews posted must be sent by staff as other patients that are registered with this group that I have spoken to have the same opinion and experiences.
Please don't blame this on COVID like they normally do. We understand that there is pressure on the NHS, but this group has got worse when it comes to patient care then they were before.

title: Rude Receptionist
body: Being with the surgery a number of years I was very upset when I had to phone up my doctor as I had run out of medication, which is totally my fault, my medical condition prevents me to remember important information. I explained that I have not got my medication for the next few days and must talk to my doctor about a review of my meds. The receptionist said well maybe next time remember you run out of tablets. Very bluntly, I explained that my medical condition prevents me from remembering important information she belittled me saying I'm the one here trying to help you get a doctor. Her tone was patronising and I've left the call feeling upset, I'm with the wellbeing service at the moment on an urgent referal and comments such as these have affected me and was not needed.

title: Blood tests
body: Had blood tests for the first time at the surgery last Friday and it was a great experience - so much better than going to Kingston hospital.  Please keep the service there!

title: Vile Reception
body:
I am absolutely appalled at the rudeness and apparent lack of training of the receptionist here.
I had to return a call I was unable to take due to being in bereavement counselling at the time of the call and whilst I explained this, the rudeness and lack of compassion I received was unforgivable.  If a patient is in obvious distress, it is unacceptable to address them in this manner.
Please ensure this team is given appropriate training.

title: Excellent Service and Organization
body: My wife and I attended the annual flu 'jab' session on Saturday 3rd October 2020.  The organization and efficiency was superb as usual.

title: Terrible service
body: I was booked in for an appointment at 11.40am. I was advised not to arrive until the time of my appointment due to COVID-19 restrictions, I arrived on time and was temperature tested and signed in. This took me  three minutes over my appointment time and I was refused my appointment. No budge with reception staff just told I needed to book another appointment. Iâ€™m unsure if it is lack of training or just poor people skills.

title: Flu Jab
body: Prompted by a text message - the Flu Jab session was carried out efficiently by all staff. A further demonstation of the care and professionalism of the Team at the surgery. Thank you all.
